* Source:
*
*   http://www.belgocontrol.be/
*
*   AIP Part 2 EN-ROUTE (ENR)
*   ENR 5 NAVIGATION WARNINGS
*    ENR 5.5 Aerial sporting and recreational activities
*     2. LOW FLYING AREAS GOLF
*
*   Belgian border data was extracted from
*   http://downloads.cloudmade.com/europe/western_europe/belgium/belgium.poly
*
* Last check:
*
*   Wim Verhoeve (1 March 2012)
*
* Map List:
* 
*   MAP WEEK           NO
*   MAP WEEKEND        NO
*   MAP WEEKEND_LFAG1  NO
*   MAP WEEKEND_LFAG2  YES
*   MAP WEEKEND_LFAG5  YES
*
* Remark for paragliders:
*   - As we are allowed to fly in the LFA G areas, the AH limit is our AL
*
* Type of restriction / nature of hazard:
*   - Glider activity.
*
* Time of activity:
*   - HX (Only during activation of Low Flying Area Golf One. Brussels ACC will
*         release Low Flying Area Golf Two South up to FL 70 on request of the
*         "Fédération des Clubs francophones de Vol à voile" with 30 MIN prior
*         notice to be addressed to the Brussels ACC Chief Controller. Activation
*         of Low Flying Areas Golf Two activates Low Flying Area Golf Three and
*         shall only be requested when meteorological services expect thermal
*         activity above FL 50. Activation can be checked with Brussels ACC Chief
*         Controller (TEL +32 (0) 2 206 27 22) or Brussels FIC on FREQ 126.900
*         MHz.)

AC G
AN LOW FLYING AREA GOLF 2 SOUTH
AH FL 75 (excl)
AL FL 55
